p: In case 2, atmospheric model surface heat flux biases drive local SST biases through ocean heat transport convergence balancing response, i.e. small ∆ C O and ∆ F R so ∆ C R ≈ λ C∆ T ≈ −∆ F A. The atmospheric model provides surplus heat into the surface causing the local SST to warm resulting in a compensating negative ocean heat transport convergence response (or vice-versa). We expect for R1 no correlation of ∆ F R on SST biases (and a negative correlation of ΔC R on SST biases which we can’t test); for R2 a strong positive correlation of SST biases on ∆ F A; for R3 no correlation of ∆ F R on ∆ F A; and for R4 strong positive correlation of SST biases on coupled net flux bias (∆Δ F). Our results contrast with expectations for R1, R2 and R3, ruling out this case.
